intro: Tapina variegata, commonly known as the variegated tapinanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Loganiaceae. It is characterized by its striking variegated leaves that display a mix of green, white, and yellow patterns. Native to tropical regions of Africa, this plant thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil. It produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its unique foliage.
